title: Body Language
description: Michael is hopeful that a potential client is interested in him, but everyone in the office except Pam thinks he's wasting his time. Meanwhile, Dwight recruits Kelly to apply for the Sabre minority management training program.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Buenos dias, Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Buenos dias, Miguel. [phone rings] Hello, Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. Solamente en espanol, por favor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I believe that every man, woman, and child in this country should learn how to speak Spanish. They are our neighbors to the South, and this would be a healing thing for... for all of North America. And... I am going on vacation next week to Cancun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Buenos dias, Jaime.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Buenos dias, Miguel. Como estas? Bien? Claro que si! Yo estoy fantastico. Que pasa?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ha ha! Buenos dias, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Guten tag, Herr Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't understand why Michael is wasting his time with Spanish. I have it on very good authority that within 20 years, everyone will be speaking German. Or a Chinese-German hybrid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: La telefona.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: El telefono.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael's having a hard time with the gender part of Spanish. So I told him to mark everything with the international symbol for gender. And, um... [holds up two blurred-out drawings of male and female genitalia] I should have been more specific.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Your office is full of genitalia.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] Oh. Eso es lo que dice, el!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: "That's what he says?"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Damn it. [knock on door] Ah, Angelo.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Angela. [Michael sticks post-it on Angela's forehead with female genitalia] Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yo soy Cancun.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [removes post-it, leaves] Uhh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, so I'll finish up on bulk pricing, and then you go into delivery guarantee.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, maybe there's an opportunity for a joke there, like, um... like, [vaudeville delivery] "I just delivered a baby. They didn't offer me a guarantee."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, or maybe we don't even need that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can you smell the power of the Halperts? Power couple.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what? I should be getting this client, Michael. My numbers are better than either of theirs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I went with the people I thought would put the best face on the company.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you want people to put the best face on something, why would you get two people who probably never cut the face off of anything in their lives?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispers] That's a good point.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is our first joint sales pitch. I think we're gonna work really well together.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah I think we have complimentary strengths. We understand each other.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We have good give and take. [vaudeville delivery] I give, he takes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispering] I don't even know who you are anymore.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [vaudeville delivery] Yee.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Hi, uh, Donna Newton, here to see Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, hey, Miss Newton. Hi, I'm Jim.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did somebody order a hooker over here?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: [laughing] Oh, stop that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There's this woman I met a few weeks ago. Her name is Donna, the manager of Sid & Dexter's and, right now, we're in the midst of a passionate love affair. Um, no. But she is coming by today. Maybe to buy some printers, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right here, we have the wonder twins, Jim and Pam Halpert. They will be assisting you today.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: You look exactly alike.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no we're actually married. We're not brother and sister.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: I have a sense about these things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: You have some ancestors in common... somewhere back.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I knew it. You should see their baby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [explaining PowerPoint to Donna] So, yes, laser printers are more expensive. But they cost less to operate [knocking] So it's a tradeoff.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [barges in] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hold on one second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry to interrupt. Sorry to interrupt. Do you, Donna, by any chance shop at Victoria's Secret?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because I keep getting these magazines sent to me via the address of the woman who used to live in my condo before me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: None of this is time sensitive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, yes, uh, the sale is on now through May.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I have more of them.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You would have weekly conference calls with executives in corporate. A two-week training program at the Yale school of management, obviously you would be high on the list for advancement opportunities.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Sounds all right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh, this is "Print in All Colors," Sabre's minority executive training program.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It doesn't just sound a'ight, it sounds amazing.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I didn't say "a'ight."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How do I apply?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You have to be a minority.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, glasses wearers. Cholera survivors. Geniuses. Non-organic family farmers. The list goes on and on. You want me to keep going?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Those don't really count. We're thinking more ethnic and racial minorities.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come here. Come here.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ten seconds ago, this guy was driving a forklift. Okay? Now all off a sudden he's Cinderella of the office. What are you guys thinking?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I like the sound of this. [looks at Dwight] Maybe one day I'll be sitting in Michael's chair. Wouldn't that be something?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One minority from this branch is going to get into this program. Who would I refer? Hmm... the competent, hardworking one who does things his own way, or the malleable simpleton who can be bought for a few fashion magazines?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [on phone] This is the second time that you've sent me the wrong size. I mean, I know what a four feels like. I've been a four my whole life. You know what? You can go to Hell. All right? Thanks for nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man. White people, right?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't know if she was white.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, you can kinda tell from the voice.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I bet you get pulled over by the cops a lot, just because of your race.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, they say it's because of texting, but maybe you're right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think you should consider applying for the executive minority training program.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Never thought of myself as an executive before.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know, 'cause you have no role models. How many Indian CEO's can you think of?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I can't think of any CEO's, any race.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You could be the Indian Bill Gates. You could be the Indian Ted Turner.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I could be the Indian Julia Roberts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's not... she's... okay. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I took the liberty to scan a few things earlier, and I want to show you... there we go! [Michael's picture pops up on the PowerPoint screen] Whoa, look at those vivid colors. Look at my eyes. Those are Shrek-green eyes. That is me again. I think this displays the crisp, dazzling white.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And that would be a display [image from a catalog of a man wearing only white boxers pops up] of the crisp, gorgeous black.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's subtle. That's how it works. I show her an image that turns her on. 	And then she looks at me, then back at me, then back at the image. Soon, she doesn't know what is me, what is the image. She just knows that she's turned on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is a place that I like to go to be alone with my thoughts. I've never taken anybody there before.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Who took the photo?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh. [Michael quickly advances PowerPoint show to last slide which is "SEX" in bold white letters on a black background and then exits the show quickly]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And that's it. That's me. That's who I am.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: [giggles] Not bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thanks. [softly] You're not bad, either.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Thank you. [Michael tries t kiss Donna, Donna clears throat] Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh my God. [realizing Jim and Pam are looking through the conference room windows]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim! Could you come in here for a sec? What was that printer we were looking at?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in his office] You didn't see it, Pam. She was giving me all sorts of signals that she wanted me to make a move. Shortbread?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'll have one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, maybe you shouldn't try to kiss people at work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh really, Jim? What about Pam? And you did a heck of a lot more than kiss. Maybe this could be my Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Well, all that is irrelevant.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe Michael has a point. I mean, if she was really that upset, she wouldn't still be here.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Was it professional? No. But I work in the nightlife industry. I get hit on all the time. In my 20's it would have been annoying. In my late 20's, I find it really flattering.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, I know that I screwed up in there. I know that I probably messed up your sale. I just want to go in and fix it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What if I back out and you finish the pitch with Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just let him flirt with her. People meet each other all sorts of ways.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, you know he's not gonna get anywhere, and he's gonna blow our sale.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who cares? [Michael peeking at them through his office window] It's not that huge a sale.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, the Schwab guy told us to treat every sale like it was a huge sale.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don't act like you understood anything that guy said. [pat's Jim's arm] Good luck, wingman. [salutes]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How as being a minority affected you?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, there's a lot of pressure from my parents to settle down and marry an Indian guy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, good, and you resent this because...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Indian guys always wear their cell phones outside their pants. It's so dorky.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no, no. That's not dorky. [Dwight wears his phone like that] Look, it's easily accessible. Boom, like this. 911, hello. Scranton Strangler's in the house. Inside the house.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Just put it in your pocket.

quotes.speaker: {Michael} and {Donna}
quotes.text: [indistinct chatter inside conference room]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [looking it] Look at that. She's totally flirting with him.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You don't know that. Some people can't help oozing sexuality.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You ever notice you can ooze two things:

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Is this... is this the best you can do right there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, for that printer, yes. Unfortunately we don't have a lot of flexibility.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh. Well, I guess I'm just used to the restaurant business, [removes sweater revealing her revealing top] where, if you're in charge, then you can always get discounts for the people that you like.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So maybe we could find a little wiggle room, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe wee find some wiggle room?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't... I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think we could. [Donna giggles]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't see how we could possibly sell these for that little without losing money. Delivery alone will cost...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well sometimes... sometimes it makes financial sense to lose money, right? Like for tax purposes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Actually, ran the numbers on this, and in this case, it makes more financial sense to gain money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don't you run them again?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What if she's just flirting with you to get a better price?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If she is, it's working.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, Michael, here's a trick. Ask her if she wants a mint. If she says "no," then she is not interested.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She does not like him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can flirt with someone to get what you want and also be attracted to them. How do you think we got together?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: 'cause I stopped by your desk like 15 times a day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was after your money.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, the joke was on you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, it was.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [typing] Can you stop micromanaging? I know how to do this.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey... what are you guys doing?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: This girl was really rude to me at the mall. So I created a fake I.M. account from a hot guy at her high school, and now I'm trying to make her anorexic.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Tell her everyone in home room thinks she's fat.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, that is so good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know, we really should keep practicing for this interview.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, that's okay. Ryan coached me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ryan? What does he know?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's easy... you just turn every question around on them. Do you think you're treated differently because of your race?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Would you ask that same question if I was white? We're so in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "We?"

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: When I become executive, I'm gonna make Ryan manager.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And then the two of us are cleanin' house.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kelly will be even worse than Darryl. If you'd have told me this morning that today I'd be creating a monster capable f my own destruction, I 'd have thought you were referring to the bull Mose and I are trying to reanimate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So corporate approval of this contract is contingent upon buyer and seller...

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Operating blahdy blahdy blah. Boilerplate. Pound of fish. [Donna laughing] Just kidding. Do you like mints?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I carry mints with me sometimes. You ever tried those?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh, I haven't tried those. No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They're good [Donna grabs mint]

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: You want one?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: It's like cool... "certified cool." I like how they say "certified." Like there's some consortium of... [Michael grabs the mint from Donna's hand with his mouth, Donna pulls her hand away] Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't stop myself from kissing her.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, now you know how I feel sitting next to those M&M's all day.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, why don't you just move the M&M's?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, why don't you shut up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, guys, guys, guys. Just tell me it's not totally insane to try one more time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It is totally insane.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, he's right. You are turning into a stalker.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think it's over, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ehh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, some for, some against.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nobody's for.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um... I think it's really, really unlikely.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really unlikely. But I can't say that it's impossible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not saying she's in love with him. But she could have left a while ago. Most printer sales are done over the phone, Ms. Boob shirt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going with Pam's group.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael. Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, guys, guys, guys. Guys, just... thank you for talking. Wish me luck.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What sort of movie would Rudy have been if he had just stopped, given up, after two rejections? Would have been a lot shorter. Probably been a lot funnier. But it would have ultimately been a disappointment. I still would have seen it, but that's not... the point.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kelly is disqualified!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You said the program is not open to Caucasians. Well... anthropologically, she is Indian. Indians migrated from the caucuses region of Europe. Therefore, technically, she is Caucasian. You're welcome, America.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yeah, but she's not white, though.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, obviously, she is brownish. But come on, I mean, Darryl is far more ethnic.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Darryl withdrew his application. He said the Yale program interfered with his softball league, you know? He's gone.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I got my whole life to be a minority executive. I only have about a year left in these knees, though.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kelly is the only applicant.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yeah, unless somebody else applies today.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Namaste.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, dear God. Okay. Don't make any decisions just yet. Okay? I'll be right back.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: That's very nice. [referring to Kelly's bindi] I never noticed that before.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Sometimes my bangs cover it.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yeah. I don't want to be offensive but, uh... may I ask you what that means?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I do find that offensive, actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We should have your contract done by Thursday.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh, great. Great, I will look out for that stuff, then.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: And, um... you know I just wanted to say it was really... really nice to do business with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah it was nice to do business with you, too.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Thank you. Did I... get everything?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know. I think so.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Yeah, I think so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispers] Okay. So... Oh, Donna?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Yeah? Do you need validation? We don't... we don't validate.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: No, it's just in the lot, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you so much.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: You're welcome. [they hug] You're... welcome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm. [Donna giggles]

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [follows her out of office] Ahem. So, um... okay, if you have... if there's any other questions that you have...

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: I don't have, uh, any other questions. [blind clanking as she leans against door to prevent from Michael kissing her] I'm just gonna... make my way down to...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. All right. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Bye-bye!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And have a good elevator ride.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, what's that out there?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, how did it go? [Michael goes in his office and closes door]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How would one of you feel if I told you I could put you on a fast track to an executive position at this company?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Holy cow. I'd be so happy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wasn't talking to you, pale-face.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I know. I meant I'd be happy for them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What I'm offering is a ticket on a bullet train straight to middle management.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Dwight, I know these programs. "Every color is important because, together, we make a rainbow."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'll slap you in the face with a rainbow.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Mm!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Speaking of rainbows, Oscar... you are kind of a double minority. Gay. So we at Sabre could really benefit from your perspective.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Dwight, we know Kelly applied. We're not gonna cross her. No matter how good the program is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can protect you from Kelly. [Erin stifles laugh] Will you get out of here? Seriously. [Erin turns and leaves kitchen]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: For hobbies, um, yoga, belly dancing, snake charming. Beds of nails. I like lying on them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa. Whoa, whoa, whoa! This is Hide Toshi Hasagawa. He would like to apply for the Sabre minority executive training program "print in all colors" initiative.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Dwight:

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Michael. [Michael is sitting on couch outside his office] How you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know. I don't know. Can't really trust my feelings anymore.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know what, Michael? For what it's worth... I was wrong, too. I thought she was interested in you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She suckered you too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Was it the cleavage?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, and the shoulder cutouts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, you know, it's easy to get fooled. Bob's warehouse guys flirt with me all the time. It... it's mostly harmless. Usually I don't let it go too far.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know, when I tore my scrote, I was, uh... I was seeing this really hot urologist about it, and thought she was into me. But now I think she was just doing a bunch of stuff to bill my HMO. You know, she's touching around down there. It's easy to get confused.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Michael, I think Donna left this here. Should I put it in the lost and found for 14 days and then I can take it home?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God. She left this here?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Maybe she wants me to return this to her at her work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. This could be a signal. People don't just take barrettes off.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's not a signal. It's just a coincidence. No, it's not even a coincidence. It's just something that happened.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hold up barrette] Well...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She doesn't want you to return the barrette. She's not interested in you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I know. I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. You're right. Thank you. Thanks everybody. [waves, returns to his office, clears throat, turns around and runs out of office]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael! [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [runs down to parking lot, sighs]

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: [still in parking lot sitting in her car] Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. You're still here. I have your baguette.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Everyone, it is my pleasure to announce our newest member of the Sabre minority executive training program. Kelly Rajnigandha Kapoor. [clapping] All right.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: They're going to be pretty pleased in Tallahassee that I snagged an Indian for the program. She'll be the first. The program's mostly black. It's almost too black. That didn't sound right.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [puts a bindi on Erin's forehead] And the best part is is that I get a business stipend to buy all new clothes. So you can totally buy any of my old clothes that I'm not gonna need anymore.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, my God, thank you so much. I love that denim jumpsuit you have. How much?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh. Actually I was thinking about clothes that I was just gonna give to Goodwill anyway.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, kiddo. Congratulations are in order. You deserve it. [Dwight extends his hand, but Kelly hugs him]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Thank you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'll never forget everything that you've done for me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gosh. He he.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Because I never forget anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just once, I would like to be a puppet master and have nothing go wrong. Is that too much to ask?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Everybody told me that you weren't interested. Everybody. And I didn't believe 'em. And they were right. So... there's your barrette.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: No, y-you were... right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: You were right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: About what?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: You were right. [Michael leans into Donna's car to kiss her and they kiss passionately] I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. No.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: I'm sor...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No... [they kiss again]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [returns to office] What happened?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Kelly got into the minority training program.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?! Oh, that's great. That's such good news. I did it! [all look at him] I kissed. We kissed.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I'm serious. It... this happened. I went down to the parking lot and I was... I returned her barrette [holds up barrette] We ki... We did. Okay. We did. We did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? It doesn't matter. Because I know it happened. And that is all that counts. [shouts] I did do it!
